p.s: By starting his speech with a metaphor strapped to a doomsday device (l. 3) he wants to show how important the topic of the climate crisis is and that we want our planet to be still alive.
He also compares the role of the global leaders to the role of James Bond (l. 6), which determindsdetermines that they are in the position to provide our world from the climate change.
Boris Johnson also uses inclusive language in his whole speech (for example l. 10, l. 30, l. 46).
Through that he wants to show that we are all affected by the climate change and that we all have to do something about that.
By referring to Copenhagen (l. 10) and Paris (l. 11) he wants to express that we know the problem and also made promises but did not change anything.

In addition to that he also stands out that we will not succeed by government spending alone (l. 22), which shows that the cliamte crisis is a huge problem that can't be solved by a single state alone so that all leaders have to woryworry together.
Furthermore he stresses that the following generation will judge us and will also know that Glasgow was the turning point (l. 38 ff.).
Through this he wants to make clear that Glasgow.

Through this he wants to make clear that Glasgow is the last opportunity to provide the worst of the climate change, so we have to start taking climate crisis for real so the following generations can notcannot judge us for doing nothing.

With the anaphora we have the ideas.We have the technology.We have the bankers.We have the corporations and the NGOs (l. 46 f.), Johnson wants to show that we have all the opportunities we need to change something.
But it is also an appeal that we have the opportunities so we have to take action.
In his last paragraph he reffersrefers back to his comparismcomparison with James Bond (l. 48).
Additionally he says that we have the duty to change something (l. 49f.) which is an appeal to the other leaders that we have to take action.
He ends his speech with the appeal Yes, it's going to be hard.But yes, we can do it (l. 51f.) which should encourage the other leaders to take the climate crises real and take action.
All in all you can say that Boris Johnson wants to get the other leaders also the point that the start to change something about the climate change so that they can work together against it.
